intro: Rhodostemonodaphne antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian daphne, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the cloud forests of Antioquia, Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
